channel.title: Comments on: A better body-class function for WordPress

item.title: By: Brent Lagerman
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description: Thanks Marty, you've convinced me to retire our function in favor of a filter on the body_class function... My main gripe with it is that it returns SO much crap I don't need and not some of the obvious stuff a themer would want... Thanks for pointing out this method though, it seems like a better way to do it.

item.title: By: Marty Thornley
item.dc:creator: Marty Thornley
item.content:encoded:
You can add or remove any classes you want using the ‘body_class’ filter. I personally use the body classes all the time but if you want simpler, it’s easy to filter it to be whatever you want.

return apply_filters( ‘body_class’, $classes, $class );
